description: Creates a new configured table resource.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the configured table.

parameters.name: tableReference
parameters.description: A reference to the table being configured. glue (dict) --- If present, a reference to the Glue table referred to by this table reference. The name of the Glue table. The name of the database the Glue table belongs to. snowflake (dict) --- If present, a reference to the Snowflake table referred to by this table reference. The secret ARN of the Snowflake table reference. The account identifier for the Snowflake table reference. The name of the database the Snowflake table belongs to. The name of the Snowflake table. The schema name of the Snowflake table reference. The schema of the Snowflake table. v1 (list) --- The schema of a Snowflake table. (dict) --- The Snowflake table schema. The column name. The column's data type. Supported data types: ARRAY, BIGINT, BOOLEAN, CHAR, DATE, DECIMAL, DOUBLE, DOUBLE PRECISION, FLOAT, FLOAT4, INT, INTEGER, MAP, NUMERIC, NUMBER, REAL, SMALLINT, STRING, TIMESTAMP, TIMESTAMP_LTZ, TIMESTAMP_NTZ, DATETIME, TINYINT, VARCHAR, TEXT, CHARACTER. athena (dict) --- If present, a reference to the Athena table referred to by this table reference. The workgroup of the Athena table reference. outputLocation (string) --- The output location for the Athena table. The database name. The table reference.

nested_params.name: glue
nested_params.description: If present, a reference to the Glue table referred to by this table reference.

nested_params.name: tableName
nested_params.description: The name of the Glue table.

nested_params.name: databaseName
nested_params.description: The name of the database the Glue table belongs to.

nested_params.name: snowflake
nested_params.description: If present, a reference to the Snowflake table referred to by this table reference.

nested_params.name: secretArn
nested_params.description: The secret ARN of the Snowflake table reference.

nested_params.name: accountIdentifier
nested_params.description: The account identifier for the Snowflake table reference.

nested_params.description: The name of the database the Snowflake table belongs to.

nested_params.name: tableName
nested_params.description: The name of the Snowflake table.

nested_params.name: schemaName
nested_params.description: The schema name of the Snowflake table reference.

nested_params.name: tableSchema
nested_params.description: The schema of the Snowflake table.

nested_params.name: v1
nested_params.description: The schema of a Snowflake table.

nested_params.name: columnType
nested_params.description: The column's data type. Supported data types: ARRAY, BIGINT, BOOLEAN, CHAR, DATE, DECIMAL, DOUBLE, DOUBLE PRECISION, FLOAT, FLOAT4, INT, INTEGER, MAP, NUMERIC, NUMBER, REAL, SMALLINT, STRING, TIMESTAMP, TIMESTAMP_LTZ, TIMESTAMP_NTZ, DATETIME, TINYINT, VARCHAR, TEXT, CHARACTER.

nested_params.name: athena
nested_params.description: If present, a reference to the Athena table referred to by this table reference.

nested_params.name: workGroup
nested_params.description: The workgroup of the Athena table reference.

nested_params.name: outputLocation
nested_params.description: The output location for the Athena table.

parameters.name: allowedColumns
parameters.description: The columns of the underlying table that can be used by collaborations or analysis rules. (string) ---

parameters.name: analysisMethod
parameters.description: The analysis method allowed for the configured tables. DIRECT_QUERY allows SQL queries to be run directly on this table. DIRECT_JOB allows PySpark jobs to be run directly on this table. MULTIPLE allows both SQL queries and PySpark jobs to be run directly on this table.

parameters.name: selectedAnalysisMethods
parameters.description: The analysis methods to enable for the configured table. When configured, you must specify at least two analysis methods. (string) ---

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: An optional label that you can assign to a resource when you create it. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. When you use tagging, you can also use tag-based access control in IAM policies to control access to this resource. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.description: The types of analysis rules associated with this configured table. Currently, only one analysis rule may be associated with a configured table.
